heif.boxes

Class FullBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • heif.boxes.Box
      • heif.boxes.FullBox
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuxiliaryTypePropertyBox, DataInformationBox.DataEntryBox, DataInformationBox.DataReferenceBox, HandlerBox, ImageSpatialExtentsProperty, ItemInfoEntry, ItemInformationBox, ItemLocationBox, ItemPropertyAssociationBox, ItemReferenceBox, MetaBox, PixelInformationBox, PrimaryItemBox

    public class FullBox
extends Box
    This code creates a complete class that stores ubiquitous high-level data applicable for the majority of the derived Box objects, serving as the complete primary header box. It maintains details such as the entire size and type header, fields, and potentially contained boxes. This feature supports the parsing process of the HEIC file. For further technical details, refer to the Specification document - ISO/IEC 14496-12:2015 on Pages 6 and 7 under Object Structure.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • FullBox

        public FullBox(Box box,
               ByteStreamReader reader)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a FullBox by extending a standard Box header with version and flags data.

        According to ISO/IEC 14496-12, a FullBox contains a 1-byte version field and a 3-byte flags field immediately following the standard box header.

        Parameters:
        box - the base Box header containing size and type (FourCC)
        reader - the reader positioned at the start of the version field
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the 4-byte version/flags payload

      • FullBox

        public FullBox(FullBox box)
        This copy constructor creates a new FullBox object by copying all field variables from another FullBox object.
        Parameters:
        box - the other FullBox object to copy from

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public int getVersion()
        Returns the integer identifying the version of this particular box's format details.
        Returns:
        a value representing the version

      • getFlags

        public int getFlags()
        Returns the value of the flag as an integer.
        Returns:
        an integer value representing the flag

      • isFlagSet

        public boolean isFlagSet(int mask)
        Checks if a specific bit or set of bits is enabled within the box flags.

        This is commonly used in HEIF parsing to check for functional signals, such as the "self-contained" flag (0x000001) in Data Entry boxes.

        Parameters:
        mask - the bitmask to test against the 24-bit flags field
        Returns:
        true if any of the bits specified in the mask are set; false otherwise

      • getFlagsAsBinaryString

        public java.lang.String getFlagsAsBinaryString()
        Formats the flags representing the 24-bit padded binary string of the flag map.
        Returns:
        a string displaying the binary representation

      • logBoxInfo

        public void logBoxInfo()
        Logs the box hierarchy and internal entry data at the debug level.

        It provides a visual representation of the box's HEIF/ISO-BMFF structure. It is intended for tree traversal and file inspection during development and degugging if required.

        Overrides:
        logBoxInfo in class Box
